Instruction: Peel and mince the garlic cloves. Strip the rosemary and thyme leaves from their stems and chop them finely.
In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the herb rub.
Place the pork loin roast on a cutting board and pat it dry with paper towels.
Rub the herb mixture all over the surface of the pork loin roast, ensuring it is evenly coated.
Transfer the seasoned pork loin roast to a roasting pan or baking dish.
Roast the pork loin in the preheated oven for 60-70 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F.
Once cooked, remove the pork loin roast from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing.
Slice the pork loin roast into thick slices and serve hot.
